title: Zed
body:
Riot has ignored Zed long enough!

For the last 2 months he has had around a 50% ban rate, which soars above everyone else, and now it is at 73%

are you listening Riot? 73%!!!

people don't ban someone 73% of the time for no reason, Yes we know he's your little pet cos of faker and co. but its time to put favourites aside. 

Do something to Zed. 73% of the population DO NOT want him in their games!

replies.body:
http://i.imgur.com/oKZBl0R.png

Look I think Zed is maybe slightly overtuned since the QSS nerf but hes really not that bad. IMO Leblanc atm is just a better version of Zed lol.

If players want to ban a champion that isnt OP that doesnt mean Riot should just nerf it -_- I think they take much more into account than Ban rate when thinking about the strength of a champion. 

remember player perception plays a huge role in what gets picked and banned as well. Not just how strong a champion is. Thats why Lee is always top in pick rate for jungle but has a sub 50% win rate.

http://i.imgur.com/dQwEuPI.png

Player perception is just as strong of a factor for nerfs as any other, it means that 73% of teams miss out on a otherwise tactical ban, because they feel forced to ban Zed, that isn't healthy for the game. 

Sure lee isn't the most powerful of champs, but he sure as hell is one of the most annoying, just like Zed.

 And if like in Zed's case, the majority of people DO NOT want him in their games, then regardless of wether he is OP or not, he should be changed in some way to make him less hated. 

pretend that RIOT is the Coca-Cola company, and they release a new drink, if 11% of the population LOVE it, but 73% hate it and will ban it from being in the shops in their area, Coke will withdraw the drink and change it wont they. So why should riot be any different? Why disadvantage 73% of players to make the 11% that play Zed happy? (and tbh I'm sure that Zed mains will want Zed nerfed (or changed) too because then they can actually play their favourite champ in ranked again)

I seriously Disagree with this, Zed is in a good place at the moment. He doesnt need any changes as he is an ideal assassin. He has many pros especially with the most recent change to Quicksilver Sash. BUT dont be fooled he click to kill champion. He does have a skill cap and with the most recent change to zhonyas  he isnt as deadly early game as he used to be. There are alternative ways to deal with zed too. Lulu is awfully good mid and can deal plenty of damage in team fights whilst still providing plenty of utility. 

TL;DR look at what zed is strong against and be aware of the chance he can be picked in champ select and have a plan ready to beat him. Exhaust helps plenty!

I think {{champion:238}} is in a decent spot. Sure i'd like to see some tweaks and he is considered overall a safe pick but I find him not quite overpowering. If you understand how {{champion:238}} works then you'd also understand how to play against him.  There are numerous ways in which you can successfully defeat a {{champion:238}} and not necessarily have to be a hard counter to him.

zed is just annoying as a champion 

i always ban zed or ekko because i just dont want an awful one on my team or deal with one on the enemy team

you're right, they should gut him into an unplayable champ so no one has to vs that cancer champ ever again.
especially after the qss change.

I would be fine with Zed if his ult had a maximum time and distance for its return so he couldn't ult someone and chase them half way down lane and press his get out of jail for free button and if he didn't have such an easy laning phase I don't really care about assassins being good at killing **c**unts I hate it when they are overly safe like Zed or Ekko etc.

Yea his switching back to R after a fight, is the worst thing about him. It should have a maximum range like you say.

It also should have an indicator like LB's dash and R-dash, you can tell which one his her R because its purple, Where Zed's shadows look exactly the same. 

Assassins should be high-risk high-reward. But with Zed and Ekko, wheres the risk??
For LB and Fizz, at least they have the choice to either use their escape to leave the fight when things go south, but doing so cuts a HUGE chunk of their damage out. Zed doesn't sacrifice any damage for an easy escape.
